CatDescriptText: Cutline of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. 6 reads:"State NAACP to Meet Here Oct. 23, 24, 25 - The 25th annual meeting of the Pennsylvania State Conference, NAACP, will be held Oct. 23, 24, 25 in Hotel Sherwyn. Addresses by U.S. Senator Joseph S. Clark, Democrat from Pennsylvania, and Thurgood Marshall, chief legal counsel for the NAACP, will climax the three-day meeting."
TitMainTitle: Men, including Roland Sawyer and K. Leroy Irvis at center table on right, and Reverend Charles Foggie second from right at back table, and women, at banquet in Hotel Sherwyn during NAACP state convention
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Irvis, K. Leroy, 1919-National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.Hotel Sherwyn (Pittsburgh, Pa.)
